intro: Codariocalyx microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved codariocalyx, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
